intro: Knautia dumetorum, commonly known as the mountain knautia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its tall, branched stems and clusters of pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Knautia dumetorum is also valued for its ornamental qualities and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
